title: tree
name: tree
description:
This Tag is not supported yet.
		Lets you put a tree control in a cfform. Validates user selections. Tree items are created with
  cftreeitem tags inside the cftree tag block. You can use a CFML query to supply data to the tree.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A name for the cftree control.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Yes or No. Whether user must select an item in the tree control. Default is No.

attributes.name: delimiter
attributes.description: The character used to separate elements in the form variable path.

attributes.name: completepath
attributes.description:
Yes passes the root level of the treename.path form variable when the cftree is submitted. If
	omitted or No, the root level of this form variable is not included. You must set this attribute to
	Yes for the preserveData attribute of cfform to work with the tree.

attributes.name: appendkey
attributes.description:
Yes or No. When used with href, Yes passes the CFTREEITEMKEY variable along with the value of
	the selected tree item in the URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute.
	The default is Yes.

attributes.name: onValidate
attributes.description:
The name of a valid JavaScript function used to validate user input. The form object, input
	object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return true if
	validation succeeds and false otherwise.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: Message text to appear if validation fails.

attributes.name: onError
attributes.description: The name of a JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

attributes.name: lookAndFeel
attributes.description: Stylistic choice for the slider.

attributes.name: font
attributes.description: Font name to use for data in the tree control.

attributes.name: fontSize
attributes.description: Font size for text in the tree control, in points.

attributes.name: italic
attributes.description: Yes or No. Yes displays tree control text in italic. Default is No.

attributes.name: bold
attributes.description: Yes or No. Yes displays tree control text in boldface. Default is No.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Height of the tree control, in pixels.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Width of the tree control, in pixels.

attributes.name: vSpace
attributes.description: Vertical margin spacing above and below the tree control, in pixels.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: Alignment value.

attributes.name: border
attributes.description: Places a border around the tree. Default is Yes.

attributes.name: hScroll
attributes.description: Permits horizontal scrolling. Default is Yes.

attributes.name: vScroll
attributes.description: Permits vertical scrolling. Default is Yes.

attributes.name: notSupported
attributes.description:
Text to display if the page containing a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a
	browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

attributes.name: onBlur
attributes.description: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus.

attributes.name: onFocus
attributes.description: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description:
- applet: displays the tree using a Java applet in the
              browser,
            - flash: displays the tree using a Flash control
            - object: returns the tree as a Lucee structure with the
              name specified by the name attribute, For details of the
              structure contents, see "object format", below.
            - xml: Generates an XMLrepresentation of the tree.
              In XML format forms, includes the generated XML in the
              form. and puts the XML in a string variable with the name
              specified by the name attribute.
            Default: applet

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description:
Flash only: ActionScript to run when the control changes due to user action.
            If you specify an onChange event handler, the Form scope of
            the Lucee action page does not automatically get
            information about selected items. The ActionScript onChange
            event handler must handle all changes and selections.

attributes.name: style
attributes.description:
Flash only: Must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same
            syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the
            corresponding Flash element.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description:
Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer
            hovers over the control.

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description:
Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to
            show the control. Space that would be occupied by an
            invisible control is blank.
            Default: true

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description:
Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the
            control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray.
            Default: true
